q: . Donald Rumsfeld said "it's possible" that decisions on troop levels in Iraq may have been the biggest mistake of the war. He maintained that the war overall was not a mistake. I think the world's a better place with Saddam Hussein gone and with the Taliban gone and the al Qaeda out of Afghanistan, he said. Donald Rumsfeld was also critical of Colin Powell 's successor, Condoleezza Rice , for her lack of experience in government. "She'd never served in a senior administration position," he said

" Another Donald Rumsfeld nemesis, as painTed Kennedy in these pages, was Deputy Secretary of State Richard Armitage . "His leaks were so brazen," Donald Rumsfeld writes, that he told Colin Powell to manage his deputy: Rich Richard Armitage has been badmouthing the Pentagon all over town. It's been going on for some time and it's only gotten worse... I don't know what the hell is in Richard Armitage 's craw, but I'm tired of it. Colin Powell , in turn, expressed concern that Donald Rumsfeld 's deputy, Paul Wolfowitz , "was leaking against him" - which Donald Rumsfeld says he did not believe.
